required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Measurement of Circulating Cell-free DNA (cfDNA) for Diagnosis and Prognosis of Various Diseases and Evaluation of Tissue Damage
clinical_study.official_title: Development of a Fast and Sensitive Method for Measurement of Circulating Cell-free DNA (cfDNA) for Diagnosis and Prognosis of Various Diseases and Evaluation of Tissue Damage Following Trauma

brief_summary.textblock: To characterize the changes in circulating cell-free DNA (cfDNA) levels during cardiopulmonary bypass (CPB) and to access their association with outcomes compared to standard scores.

detailed_description.textblock:
In a prospective study, the investigators enrolled seventy-one consecutive patients undergoing non-emergent coronary artery bypass grafting. Blood was drawn at baseline, after 20 and 40 minutes on CPB, after cross-clamp removal, and 30 minutes after chest closure. cfDNA was measured in sera by fluorescent method.
The investigators hypothesize that cfDNA measured by will reflect the magnitude of inflammation induced by CPB. Thus, these measurements could serve for the real-time prognosis of patients undergoing cardiac surgery. The investigators correlate cFDNA to laboratories and clinical outcomes.

primary_outcome.description: intensive care unit length of stay

secondary_outcome.description: Neutrophil extracellular traps (NETs) released from activated neutrophils that undergo NETosis.

clinical_study.condition: Correlation of cFDNA During CPB to Laboratories SIRS Parameters and Clinical Outcomes

intervention.description: 5 blood samples for each patient during CABG (coronary artery bypass grafting) surgery pre/on/post cardiopulmonary bypass machine

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Elective coronary artery bypass grafting surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- Age < 18
- Non elective surgery
- other than CABG surgery
- Redo CABG
